intro: Leucopsis harveyi, commonly known as the Harvey's leucopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers that typically display a range of colors from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
